titles.title: A bill to amend the Act of August 9, 1955, to extend the authorization of certain leases.
A bill to amend the Act of August 9, 1955, to extend the authorization of certain leases.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Amends federal Indian law to authorize 99-year leases of land: (1) in the reservation of the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation; (2) in the Muckleshoot Indian Reservation and held in trust for the Muckleshoot Indian tribe; and (3) held in trust for the Prairie Band Potawatomi Nation, for the Fallon Paiute Shoshone tribes, for the Yurok tribe, and for the Hopland Band of Pomo Indians of the Hopland Rancheria.
